_meta.notes: Derived from canonical audit summary and governance mappings.

canonical_version.label: AI OSI Stack v5.0.0
canonical_version.checksum_guidance: Record SHA-512 (or equivalent) locally and store with meta/INTEGRITY_NOTICE.md

description.narrative: Community assemblies steward the Civic Charter, renewing legitimacy through periodic consent cycles.
description.normative: Charter amendments must satisfy the Civic Charter ratification quorum and Update Plan 1 accountability tests.
description.plain: We keep the project legitimate by asking communities to review and approve the Civic Charter on a set schedule.

description.narrative: Energy, compute, and logistics partners commit to tamper-evident custody for critical infrastructure.
description.normative: All facilities must log custody events to the Integrity Ledger and expose AEIP facilityAttestation receipts.
description.plain: We keep data centers honest by logging every handoff and publishing a receipt when equipment is checked.

description.narrative: Consent registries and provenance trails anchor every dataset in participatory record-keeping.
description.normative: Data onboarding requires dual attestation from Consent Custodians and the AEIP lineageLedger hook.
description.plain: Before data is used, a consent officer and an automated log both confirm the source and permissions.

description.narrative: Model builders document training runs with persona-aligned evaluation ledgers.
description.normative: Evaluation harnesses must register AEIP evaluationReceipt proofs before deployment.
description.plain: Models cannot ship until their tests are logged and a receipt confirms what was checked.

description.narrative: Instruction designers maintain persona briefs, refusal logic, and AEIP intents to honor dignity constraints.
description.normative: Persona updates must satisfy Update Plan 8 refusal protections and log through intentPacket.
description.plain: Persona rules change only when refusal safeguards are checked and logged.

description.narrative: AEIP exchanges capture deliberation context with counter-signatures from oversight personas.
description.normative: All reasoning packets must undergo AEIP aeipHandshake verification before ledger anchoring.
description.plain: Every reasoning conversation is double-checked through the AEIP handshake before it is trusted.

description.narrative: Change-control cadences and incident rehearsals keep runtime systems accountable.
description.normative: Deployments must register changeApproval receipts and simulate rollback scenarios quarterly.
description.plain: We log every release and practice incidents four times a year to stay ready.

description.narrative: Multistakeholder councils coordinate disclosure schedules with civic bodies.
description.normative: All public reports must cross-reference Governance Disclosure Statements via publicationNotice hooks.
description.plain: Before we publish, we link to a disclosure statement and confirm timing with our partners.

description.narrative: Federation partners co-create jurisdictional overlays and reciprocity agreements.
description.normative: Federated changes must follow Update Plan 13 terms and register federationSync receipts.
description.plain: Partner agreements are logged, and any change triggers a federation receipt.

description.narrative: The AEIP spine threads reasoning receipts, provenance logs, and integrity checks across all layers.
description.normative: Receipts comply with AEIP v1.3 and chain-of-custody signatures from Integrity Ledger stewards.
description.plain: AEIP keeps track of every important action so anyone can verify what happened.
